description: {"blocks":[{"key":"cb9op","text":"This protocol provides guidance for submitting bulk BioSample updates to NCBI for the GenFS Metadata Cleanup Challenge exercise.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cos4d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bthv0","text":"Table of Contents: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7n5h","text":"Timeline/Workflow for the 2024 Metadata Cleanup Challenge","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c7s46","text":"Preparing the update file","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ab4av","text":"Making corrections and updates within the file","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fq2un","text":"Submitting the finalized template","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: Guidance for preparing the update file
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bq34a","text":"Prepare the update file:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eg3ij","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bi2fd","text":"Updates should be put into one bulk update file per lab, or per lab/organism, or some other aggregation.  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fcmu3","text":"Rows: The first row, or header, must contain the column names. Each subsequent row must contain exactly one BioSample and its updatable fields, or attributes. Each row must contain exactly the same number of columns. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"agpn9","text":"Columns:  The column names should be attribute names (full name or harmonized name) included in the One Health Enteric package. The first column should contain the BioSample accession (eg SAMN123456789)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":53,"length":30}],"data":{}},{"key":"673mb","text":"File format: tab-delimited text file using the file suffix  .tsv or .txt. If you use Microsoft Excel for editing, export the final template into this format.  ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3khqr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6oplv","text":"FYI: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d9s7d","text":"Only those columns where at least one record has a replacement value need to be supplied. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"43k03","text":"If a field is blank in the update file, and has an actual value in NCBI BioSample, that will be taken as \"replace current value with NULL\". ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2i4i5","text":"If a field in a record already has a value in NCBI BioSample that will not be changed, then the field should be filled in with its current value. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5vu8m","text":"If a field is new to the BioSample, it will be added.  A blank field whose attribute does not currently exist in the BioSample record will not be added. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"57CA50E2FBD64C4FA72F275DCD451A4D","url":"https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/docs/packages/OneHealthEnteric.1.0/"}}}}

steps.section: Guidance for preparing the update file
steps.step:
{"blocks":[{"key":"6rep9","text":"What fields CANNOT be updated in the bulk update file?","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":54}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c7t7r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"19jhn","text":"DO NOT include the following attributes in this bulk update file. Changes to the following fields can be managed separately at NCBI by writing to biosamplehelp@ncbi.nlm.nih.gov.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":146,"length":30}],"data":{}},{"key":"8837v","text":"changes to organism species names ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7084n","text":"changes to strain name, isolate, or sample_name ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8r8ee","text":"changes to linked BioProject ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":1,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fq2b0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5cqc5","text":"Basically, anything to do with tracking biosamples cannot be updated using the bulk update channel. 
To make changes to any of the below fields, please write directly to pd-help@ncbi.nlm.nih.gov
 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":170,"length":24}],"data":{}},{"key":"eol64","text":"biosample_acc/BioSample – This is the primary key of the entire BioSample system - Keep this accession in the first column, but DO NOT EDIT OR UPDATE ENTRIES.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"66jis","text":"bioproject_acc/BioProject - This change requires additional processing on NCBI end, please separately write to pd-help@ncbi.nlm.nih.gov for this kind of change request.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":111,"length":24}],"data":{}},{"key":"1ld6k","text":"strain or isolate – This change requires additional processing on NCBI end, please separately
write to pd-help@ncbi.nlm.nih.gov for this kind of change request.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":10,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":103,"length":24}],"data":{}},{"key":"7vubv","text":"sample_name – Submitter’s name for the biosample.  This is published on the BioSample report.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c5qi3","text":"attribute package – This requires validation of all the fields together.  Please request this kind of change separately at pd-help@ncbi.nlm.nih.gov .","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":123,"length":24}],"data":{}},{"key":"9bu3e","text":"center name – This is a property of SRA and cannot be changed using the bulk
update channel.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b70ps","text":"organism - Change to the BioSample species (the identification of the isolate).  Please request this kind of change separately
at pd-help@ncbi.nlm.nih.gov .","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[{"key":5,"offset":130,"length":24}],"data":{}},{"key":"3s9t3","text":"Salmonella serovar/serotype  - Because of the way Salmonella are stored in NCBI taxonomy, changing the serovar (even when the species stays as Salmonella enterica) requires special handling.  Please request this kind of change separately at pd-help@ncbi.nlm.nih.gov.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":11},{"style":"italic","offset":143,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[{"key":6,"offset":241,"length":24}],"data":{}},{"key":"bcmtk","text":"Any kind of SRA to BioSample, BioSample to BioProject, or SRA to BioProject mapping.  Please write separately to pd-help@ncbi.nlm.nih.gov for this kind of change request.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":7,"offset":113,"length":24}],"data":{}},{"key":"6g7gb","text":"Any of the computed fields in Pathogen Detection (epi_type, min_same, min_diff, computed_types, or amr/virulence analysis outputs). These attributes cannot be updated by the record owner. 
","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":11,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"3A94037733C811EFA81B0A58A9FEAC02","url":"mailto:biosamplehelp@ncbi.nlm.nih.gov"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"9DC4460133BF11EFA81B0A58A9FEAC02","url":"mailto:pd-help@ncbi.nlm.nih.gov"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"9DC4460133BF11EFA81B0A58A9FEAC02","url":"mailto:pd-help@ncbi.nlm.nih.gov"}},"3":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"9DC4460133BF11EFA81B0A58A9FEAC02","url":"mailto:pd-help@ncbi.nlm.nih.gov"}},"4":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"9DC4460133BF11EFA81B0A58A9FEAC02","url":"mailto:pd-help@ncbi.nlm.nih.gov"}},"5":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"9DC4460133BF11EFA81B0A58A9FEAC02","url":"mailto:pd-help@ncbi.nlm.nih.gov"}},"6":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"9DC4460133BF11EFA81B0A58A9FEAC02","url":"mailto:pd-help@ncbi.nlm.nih.gov"}},"7":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"9DC4460133BF11EFA81B0A58A9FEAC02","url":"mailto:pd-help@ncbi.nlm.nih.gov"}}}}

steps.section: Guidance for preparing the update file
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"74d3p","text":"For labs in the GenomeTrakr network:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":36}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1f2s7","text":"We have generated a bulk metadata update template for every laboratory that has a BioProject linked to the GenomeTrakr umbrella BioProject at NCBI (PRJNA593772).  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":148,"length":11}],"data":{}},{"key":"201hv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c2sr3","text":"Pick up your metadata template here: DOCS: metadata hackathon/2024 Hackathon Template Pickup.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":37,"length":55}],"data":{}},{"key":"6qnb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fbtcf","text":"General instructions for generating a template of current metadata for a given BioProject or set of BioProjects:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":112}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7mmpi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4b68l","text":"\u003cEnter SRA Run selector instructions\u003e","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"EE74C7BD67994FDE92CA7E2906E11A79","url":"https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/bioproject/PRJNA593772"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"6235FEC6340C4D1C9A47867F661F7DE1","url":"https://www.protocols.io/file-manager/41789FF780E711EFA2E30A58A9FEAC02"}}}}

steps.section: Guidance for making corrections and updates within the file
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6pdfu","text":"food_origin","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a6505","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9n9pn","text":"**FOR FOOD OR OTHER PRODUCTS ONLY**","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6gti3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"85tfl","text":"Sort or filter on the source_type column to identify the “food” isolates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":22,"length":11},{"style":"bold","offset":58,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fakco","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"colnr","text":"Food and other products have two attributes describing geographic location information:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9e2hf","text":"geo_loc_name: geographic location where the sample was physically collected","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ep3cl","text":"food_origin: geographic origin of food product or other product sampled for pathogens ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11},{"style":"italic","offset":24,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8481a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"428ra","text":"Check location data in geo_loc_name:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":23,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a5fkg","text":"If the location information in geo_loc_name reflects the state or country of origin for the food product (e.g. “India”, reflecting an imported food product sampled in the US), move this geographic information to food_origin.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":31,"length":12},{"style":"bold","offset":212,"length":12},{"style":"italic","offset":57,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":66,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4bm4m","text":"If your isolates contain the location where the sample was collected (e.g. port of entry, US state of grocery store, etc), leave geo_loc_name as is. Populate food_origin with the country or state of origin. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":70,"length":51},{"style":"bold","offset":129,"length":12},{"style":"bold","offset":158,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"698ge","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e8mdg","text":"If food_origin is unknown, provide one of NCBI's null values: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":3,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bcllb","text":"Not Applicable ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6lbkl","text":"Not Collected ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"86v","text":"Not Provided ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5p2bg","text":"Missing ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7gcia","text":"Restricted Access ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9athb","text":"host","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6mf4r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ncr3","text":"*FOR HUMAN and ANIMAL ISOLATES ONLY*","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":36}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4f8br","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ceatj","text":"Host is a required for host associated human and animal isolates. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9d64l","text":"Use the source_type column to identify human and animal isolates (filter in Excel for human and animal). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":8,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"38ate","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bs4ck","text":"Use the entries in the isolation_source column to help determine what the host entry should be.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":23,"length":16},{"style":"bold","offset":74,"length":4},{"style":"bold","offset":94,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cgpfk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bbjjv","text":"Where possible, enter a scientific or binomial name, for example Homo sapiens or Bos taurus. If scientific name is unknown, use a common name recognized by the NCBI taxonomy database (porcine, bovine, etc). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":65,"length":13},{"style":"italic","offset":81,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":160,"length":22}],"data":{}},{"key":"bj1ru","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9nrc1","text":"When host is completely unknown, provide one of NCBI's null values: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":5,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dotha","text":"Not Applicable ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ej4al","text":"Not Collected ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"69mop","text":"Not Provided ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eq1di","text":"Missing ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9fnt4","text":"Restricted Access ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"2140BF39FFB04C088AEFE01C7B991651","url":"https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/taxonomy"}}}}

steps.section: Guidance for making corrections and updates within the file
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"41iru","text":"Steps 7-9: These steps cover required fields.  In your Excel template, ensure there's an entry in these columns for every row. steps.section: Guidance for making corrections and updates within the file
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"df1ei","text":"Steps 11-13: For this exercise we're focused on two conditionally required attributes:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"715ln","text":"host should be populated for isolates derived from human or animal samples","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ag0ec","text":"food_origin should be populated for isolates derived from food products, or other commercial products sampled for pathogens (medical products, cosmetics, tattoo ink, etc). ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cdv5g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"45trs","text":"Use the source_type column to filter for these sample types, first for animal/human samples (step 11 + 12), then for food samples (step 13). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":8,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
